True, but there is also such a thing as close platonic friendships, just because you care about someone deeply doesn't mean that you have romantic feelings towards them. Now I am not saying you can't interpret it as a romantic thing if you want to, but I do think that with that you're ruling out the idea of meaningful friendships, which is unfair imo. Obviously there has been homoerotic symbolism in Coen brothers films before, and that is not a bad thing... but I don't like it when people interpret all close same-sex friendship as sexual/romantic.

Honestly I don't think that girl calling out (the person she believed to be) Trump matters all that much, sure it is funny, but she is just a kid, she has no real opinions about politics other than what her parents have taught her.
Now I don't think that is necessarily a bad thing, and it is definitely not brainwashing or whatever some people would like to call it, I just think that is important to keep in mind that at that age kids are just parroting whatever they've heard other people say. That goes the other way too, because kids with Make America Great Again hats don't really know what any of it means either. So this whole thing is silly, it is not offensive or bad, it just not something we should take all that seriously in any capacity.

I also think one of the reasons why i loved Atlanta so much, beyond it being a really funny and clever and profound show, was that it really respected us the viewers by expecting us to be smart and empathetic and open minded. I really hate when movies or TV shows treat us like idiots by pandering to the lowest common denominator, by over explaining everything, and by not having the guts to go where it needs to go. There was nothing of that in Atlanta, Donald knew that even us white folks would be able to empathise with he characters and care about them even if he couldn't relate to all of their experiences.

I mostly stuck to Chinese food, because I didn't feel the need to eat a lot of western food, but yeah most of it was pretty bad. The pizza was the worst though, it is like they fundamentally didn't understand what a pizza was supposed to taste like... I guess part of it was due to how they probably didn't use dairy cheese.
Element Fresh was pretty decent, and there was some pretty good ones in Kunming as well.

There are other terms out there you know, if you eat dairy products but not meat for an instance, then you're a vegatarian like me. If you occasionally eat fish then you're a pescetarian, if you eat chicken then you're a pollotarian.

Criticising someone for inaccurately categorising something isn't gatekeeping OP, because some things are in fact binary. If you eat fish occasionally you aren't vegan, that is not gatekeeping, that is not a form of exclusion based on an idea of superiority, it just a fact. If you do heroin once a month you're not straight edge, you just don't do drugs very often, and if you have sex once in a while you're not celibate, you just don't get laid a lot.
You know not everyone can through willpower alone concentrate for a whole lecture or whatever, so if people have found methods to help them doing that then doesn't make them weak.
That makes a lot more sense
